meanings.definition: Abducentes: muscles that move a part of the body away from the midline
meanings.sent1: The abducentes help in moving the arms sideways.
meanings.sent2: During exercise, the abducentes are engaged in stretching movements.
meanings.sent3: The abducentes decided to take a break from pulling things apart.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the abducentes, always pushing her away from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The abducentes are like little helpers, pushing things away from the center.

meanings.definition: Abducentes: nerves that control the movement of the eye
meanings.sent1: The abducentes ensure the eyes can look to the side.
meanings.sent2: When reading, the abducentes help in shifting focus between words.
meanings.sent3: The abducentes were tired of always being the ones to look away first.
meanings.sent4: His curiosity acted like the abducentes, always pulling his gaze elsewhere.
meanings.sent5: The abducentes are like little directors, guiding the eyes to explore different views.

meanings.definition: Abducentes: a group of muscles responsible for abduction movements
meanings.sent1: The abducentes are crucial for moving the legs apart.
meanings.sent2: In dance, the abducentes play a key role in elegant leg extensions.
meanings.sent3: The abducentes were tired of always being asked to spread things out.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like the abducentes, always pulling her towards new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The abducentes are like little expanders, opening up possibilities for movement.
